sentence.Network_en: Johnson stared goggle-eyed at Kravis' sumptuous quarters.
sentence.Network_cn: 约翰逊目瞪口呆地望着克拉维斯的豪宅。

sentence.Network_en: His insincerity is revealed by the quick goggle of his eyes.
sentence.Network_cn: 他眼睛的快速转动泄露了他的不诚.

sentence.Network_en: A few of us in the press were there, goggle-eyed at the lavish hospitality.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们几位记者当时在那里，眼馋地看着丰盛的茶点。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'look to one side, squint'): probably from a base symbolic of oscillating movement

entry.def: If you goggle at something, you stare at it with your eyes wide open, usually because you are surprised by it.
Goggles are large glasses that fit closely to your face around your eyes to protect them from such things as water, wind, or dust.

auth_sentence.content: Which made him...goggle like an Owl.
auth_sentence.res_content: Which made him...goggle like an Owl.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Which made him...goggle like an Owl.

auth_sentence.content: The men are all goggle-eyed weirdos, the women, except the good cop, are varieties of witch.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The men are all goggle-eyed weirdos, the women, except the good cop, are varieties of witch.

auth_sentence.content: The vernacular names are better; Norfolk people used to call them goggle-eyed plovers, or better still, wailing heath chickens.
